utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Buona sera, Luigi’s Pizza. Buona sera. It means good evening in Italian. May I say, having to explain that to you calls into question the authenticity of your ristorante?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, I’m out of here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Un momento. Oh, for heaven’s sake, now you’re being deliberately stupid. Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m having dinner with Priya at Raj’s. I think Howard’s going to be there. You want to join us?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But tonight’s Thursday. On Thursdays, everybody comes over here and has pizza. Or a reasonable facsimile prepared by someone claiming to be Luigi, but who sounds suspiciously like Jackie Chan.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Can’t we make a one-time exception for tonight?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We could. We could also stop using the letter M, but I think that idea is isguided and oronic.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just come with me to Raj’s.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I don’t want to go to a party.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s not a party. It’s the same group of people who hang out here, hanging out over there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry, but five people eating and chatting is a party.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How come it’s not a party when we do it here?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Because we don’t throw parties.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know what to tell you, Sheldon. I’m going to see Priya. Everyone’s over there. You coming or not?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, no, sir, and do you know why? In a word, tradition. Every Thursday night for the last eight years, you and I and our friends have gathered here in this very spot to break bread covered with cheese and sauce, discuss the issues of the day, and yes, share a laugh or two. But I guess our rich heritage means nothing to you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I guess you’re right. See you later.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait! Leonard! Wait! What am I going to do for dinner?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come with me to Raj’s and eat there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can’t do that. What if he serves haggis and blood pudding?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I really doubt that’s what he’ll serve.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But what if he does? I’ll be obliged to dine on liver and lungs stuffed in a sheep’s stomach. And frankly, blood pudding is essentially the same thing. I don’t know why he’s serving both.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What do you want to do? You want to come with me, or do you want to sit here alone?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, I’ll go to your haggis party. But I’m telling you, this is adness. This is utter and coplete adness.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, dear!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Raj’s television. I just realized we’re about to spend an evening watching a plasma screen with a cluster of dead pixels in the upper left-hand corner.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So don’t watch TV. Read a book.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And be a social pariah? Oh, you know that’s not my style.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ugh!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The audible sigh is a show of exasperation, right?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is it about me or the dead pixels?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, you’re just in time. We made Tex-Mex.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, sounds great.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, Indians making Tex-Mex. Might as well have had the Chinese pizza.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Hey, you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s got to be fun for you, huh? Watching Hofstadter suck the saliva out of your sister’s mouth?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me. Before this evening goes any further, we need to decide where everyone is going to sit.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: There is no assigned seats, Sheldon. Just sit anywhere. Make yourself comfortable.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, what fun. We’re like hippies at a love-in.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just sit here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, right on, man. Right on. Oh, look, it’s Harry Potter and 98% of The Sorcerer’s Stone.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, we’ve got fajitas with all the fixins, so you make your own.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wonderful. Dinner, some assembly required.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Do you want a margarita, Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A margarita? Where are we? What is happening?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. Hey, Sheldon. What can I get ya?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Water. Neat. With a little umbrella.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Where are all your friends?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sadly, Penny, this evening, I am the Dark Knight, roaming these mean streets alone. A windbreaker for my cape, and a stern expression for my cowl.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me? Isn’t this the point where the world-weary barkeep absentmindedly wipes down the bar and coaxes the woes out of the troubled patron?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I was getting your stupid umbrella, but all right. What’s troubling you, buddy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t think your heart’s in it, but since you asked. Apparently, because Leonard is dating Raj’s sister, we’re all forced to hang out at his apartment.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, the horror.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Indeed. Yeah, at one point, Raj put on reggae music, and his sister took off her shoes. It was like the last days of Caligula. Oh, I have to get this. Umbrella?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ugh!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wonder what she’s exasperated about. Hello?

utterance.speaker: Amy (on phone)
utterance.content: Sheldon, are you all right? When last we spoke, you were going to take a taxi home from Raj’s, but according to Facebook, you just checked in at the Cheesecake Factory.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, I was in a taxi, but the driver didn’t look at all like the photograph on his license, so I leapt out and ran for it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Wise.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: There you go. Just like recovering alcoholics drink in the Caribbean.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hi, bestie.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. Hi, Amy. How you been?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Fine. From this angle, I can see up your nose.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s a great time to be alive, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t worry. My problems can wait while you two hens finish your clucking.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Look, Sheldon, Leonard is dating Priya. She is staying with Raj. That means you’re all probably gonna be hanging out there more.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Penny, I’m sorry you got dragged into this. I know you’re devastated that your ex-boyfriend has found an exciting new lover with flawless, caramel-coloured skin.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, I’m not upset about Leonard and Priya.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Your flaring nostrils indicate otherwise.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Cluck-cluck-cluck.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, look at me. I think it’s time to face the fact that Leonard is the nucleus of your social group. Where he goes, the group goes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard the nucleus? That makes no sense. I’m the whimsical elf that everyone looks to for a good time.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m not saying that you’re not fun. You’re the most fun person I know.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: A lot of people think I’m fun to be around.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Don’t be needy, bestie. That’s probably part of what chased Leonard away. What I am saying, Sheldon, is that your group is Leonard-centric. If it were a town, it would be Leonardville. If it were an Islamic nation, Leonardstan. If it were the birthplace of motion pictures, we’d all be singing Hooray for Leonardwood.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ooh, I got one. If you guys were a band, you’d be called Leonard and the Leonards.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So needy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m setting out snacks.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You do realize everyone’s eating at Raj’s again tonight?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I didn’t say the snacks were for you now, did I, Nosy Rosie?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re having people over?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. Must be killing you wondering who. Fine, I’ll tell you. Stuart from the comic bookstore, Barry Kripke from the university, Penny’s ex-boyfriend Zack and TV’s LeVar Burton.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? LeVar Burton’s coming here?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Possibly. I Tweeted him.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, well, tell him I loved him on Star Trek.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Please, Leonard, stop trying to horn in on my new friends.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Of course. Good night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We had a good run, you and I.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But change is a part of life.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It certainly is.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay. I have guests coming. I’m afraid I’m going to have to ask you to leave now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I am leaving.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t make this harder than it is, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Good-bye, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And good-bye to you, sir. He’ll be back.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Of course I’ll be back. I live here!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, it would appear LeVar Burton won’t be joining us so let’s get started. Um, I thought we’d begin by going around the room, introducing ourselves and saying a little bit about why we’re here. Okay. I’m Sheldon. Uh, for regular readers of The New England Journal of High Energy Physics, I need no introduction. If you’re not familiar with that publication, there’s a free copy in your goody bag. Stuart?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Um. Hi. I’m Stuart. I run a comic bookstore, which for financial reasons, I’m currently living in. And I guess what I’m hoping for most out of tonight is a hot shower.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s very nice, Stuart. Zack?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: I’m Zack, and I’m, uh… uh… could you come back to me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course. Barry?

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: I’m Barry Kwipke, and I’m here because you told me there was going to be a whaffle. When is the whaffle?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Patience, patience, Barry. The whaffle… the raffle is the grand finale to an evening-long festival of fun and folly.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: One more question…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, you must be present to win.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Okay, I’m ready. I’m Zack, and I’m, uh… oh, crap, why is this so hard?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, hey.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yo, P-dog.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We’re here to kidnap you for a girls’ night out.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Parenthetical, the term kidnap is being used playfully.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I kind of figured that.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Good. Now put this pillowcase over your head.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: She used to be much more fun, until Leonard punched her in the heart.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We just thought you might want to go out and have a good time, maybe go dancing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. Gee, thanks, but I’m not really in the mood.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You do understand that it will distract you from obsessing over the rich variety of sweet loving that your ex-boyfriend is currently receiving from the fiery jewel of Mumbai.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, look, if I agree to go out with you guys, will you promise to stop pestering me about Leonard and Priya?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right. I’ll go change. Come on in.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: If you’d have let me bring the chloroform, we wouldn’t have had to put up with all this jibber-jabber.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Anyway, after we get done snowboarding, I go back to the lodge and get in the Jacuzzi. There’s no one around, so naturally, I’m free-balling it. Next thing I know, this beautiful chick shows up, drunk out of her skull, wants to get in with me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Question. Was it a Jacuzzi or a hot tub?

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Weally? That’s your question?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: What’s the difference?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Jacuzzi is a commercial brand. Hot tub is the generic term, i.e., all Jacuzzis are hot tubs, but not all hot tubs are Jacuzzis.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Is that like all thumbs are fingers, but not all fingers are thumbs?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Surprisingly, yes.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Nice. Now, what exactly are toes?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Can you please get back to the drunk girl? I’d like something to think about in the shower.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Right. Anyway, she takes off all of her clothes, climbs into the hot tub, and the first thing I notice…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The water level rose.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course it did. It’s said that Archimedes, the ancient Greek mathematician, discovered the principle of displacement while taking a bath.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Tewwific. Go ahead, Zack. Naked dwunk girl, fwee-balling, continue.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Forgive me, but I think you’ll find my story is more interesting.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Does yours have wet bweasts in it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Better. It has a gold crown. You see, the king wondered how much gold was in it and charged Archimedes with coming up with the solution. Because the crown was irregularly shaped, there was no way to mathematically determine its volume. But, while bathing, Archimedes realized he could immerse the crown and measure the amount the water rose.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: So, long story short, I nailed her.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: When he finished, he shouted Eureka!

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: No, I always shout, Holy Moly! Don’t know why. Just do.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, that concludes the getting to know you portion of the evening. Who’s ready to play some vintage video games? And tonight’s selections include ColecoVision’s Smurf Rescue in Gargamel’s Castle, Atari’s Cookie Monster Munch, and for you text adventure aficionados, Zork. Pick me, pick me. I’m fun.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: That all sucks the big haiwy meatball. How about I go get the kawaoke machine out of my car, get plastered and blow the woof off this place?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Great, I’ll make a beer run.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: And I’ll take a shower. We’ll meet back here in fifteen.

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: Check.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m unhappy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: This is delicious. Where’d you learn to make chili?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: When I was at university in England, my flatmate was from Texas.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I hope she wasn’t anything like my flatmate from Texas.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Sheldon is a bit quirky, isn’t he?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, please. That crazy bastard’s looking at quirky in the rearview mirror.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Did you know that, per our roommate agreement, I have to wash my feet before I get in the shower? And not in the sink. We each have special buckets.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Raj, did you ever tell your sister about the time Sheldon got punched by Bill Gates?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Oh, God, you’re kidding.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Nope. Gates gave a speech at the university. Sheldon went up to him afterwards and said, maybe if you weren’t so distracted by sick children in Africa, you could have put a little more thought into Windows Vista.”

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Bam. Right in the nose. Made me proud to own a PC.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’d like to propose a toast to a rare and wonderful Sheldon-free evening.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hear, hear.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Cheers. You realize that’s the first time we’ve ever done that without having to listen to Sheldon tell us why it’s called a toast?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Why is it called a toast?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, the ancient Romans put spiced toast in their punch bowls.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sheldon tells it better.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He kind of does.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Aw, hell, I miss him.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, where do you guys want to go dancing?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We were hoping you’d know a place.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes, perhaps somewhere packed tightly with young, beautiful bodies sweating and writhing against each other in a glorious orgy of the flesh.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, I know that place. What do you think?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That should display enough of your bosom to attract a new mate, or a hungry infant.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, let’s go through this one more time. Just because Leonard has a new girlfriend does not mean I need to go out and hook up with some guy.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: But you could if you wanted to, right?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, yeah, I guess.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Pick out the hottest guy in the room, take him home, do unspeakable things to him, then kick him to the curb with a smile on his face and teeth marks on his heinie?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: More or less.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What’s that like?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know. It’s fun while you’re doing it. And then after, it’s mostly embarrassment, self-loathing and regret.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I would take that deal all day long.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, well, it’s not gonna happen tonight. You know, for the first time in my life, I am not in a relationship, and I’m totally okay with it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You know, if being on your own is new to you, I’d be happy to share some tension-relieving techniques for ladies I’ve perfected over the years. For example, do you have an electric toothbrush?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, no.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You should get one.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It appears to be something preserved between two pieces of acrylic.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, it’s a snowflake from the North Pole. Leonard gave it to me last year.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, God, that is so romantic.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, it was.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Leonard’s really one of a kind.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Saying that while holding a snowflake is a little bit heavy-handed, don’t you think?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Let me see that. Oh, screw it. I can deal with a little self-loathing. Let’s go find me a heinie to bite.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Outstanding. And if we fail, we can always stop at CVS and pick you out a nice toothbrush. I call mine Gerard.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That’s kind of creepy.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Anybody do Walking on Sunshine yet?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Dibs.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Sheldon bought a loom and learned how to weave?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He actually got pretty good. He made us all matching serapes.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I still wear mine when there’s a nip in the air.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Now, was this before or after he adopted the 25 cats?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Long before the cats. I think it was around the time he tried to declare our apartment a sovereign nation. I still have some of the currency.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (outside)
utterance.content: All my friends. All my friends. All my friends.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I think it’s like Beetlejuice. We said his name too many times.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Come on in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey. I thought you were with your new buddies.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I had to leave. They were having fun wrong.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Come here, Sheldon. Sit here with me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Would you like some homemade chili?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are there beans in it?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Then it’s not chili. Real chili has no beans in it, but you’re from a foreign land, so your ignorance is forgiven.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Sheldon, do you want some or not?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, please. Your girlfriend’s a little short-tempered.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’d like to propose a toast to friends, no matter how quirky.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Cheers.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Priya, do you know why this is called a toast?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Actually, I do. I believe the Romans used to put spiced toast in their punch bowls.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She’s also a bit of a know-it-all. Mmm. This is good. Whatever it is.

utterance.speaker: LeVar Burton
utterance.content: Hello? I… Oh, I don’t think so. I am so done with Twitter.
